lexUnit.name: poach.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cook by simmering in a small amount of liquid

sentence.text: Now , as the waiter served them both with salmon poached in white wine , dressed with a spicy sauce and served with salad and new potatoes , she felt her mouth watering in anticipation of the meal .
Poach the salmon in the white wine and water for 5 minutes .
If necessary , poach them in a pan which is just large enough to hold them .
Poach them in apple juice or water and sugar ( ie syrup ) , or even the Gewürztraminer , for perhaps ten minutes at most .
Turn down the heat so that the water simmers gently , and poach spoonfuls of meringue in this for about 60 seconds each side .
To taste for seasoning , either fry a teaspoonful of the pate or poach it in simmering water ( it will taste less strong when cold ) .
Poach remaining apples for two mins in enough water to cover , then slice thinly and fan across the puree .
Poach the smoked haddock with the onion in water .
Meanwhile , in a wok or a large pan , gently poach the chopped celery , onion and garlic in the wine/water for 5 minutes .
It may be poached in water or stock , but I prefer to cook it in the microwave , then coat it with the black butter .
To pickle pears , poach 450g ( 1lb ) peeled firm pears in 300ml ( ½ pint ) water , with 60ml ( 4tbsp ) honey and 15ml ( 1 level tbsp ) white-wine vinegar until tender .
Poach the chopped onion and garlic in the 150 ml wine/ water for 5 minutes .
The fillets are wrapped in cling film with garden herbs and poached for six to eight minutes .
